formats.name: metaphor_machine
formats.instruction: Describe a real-world concept using an extended metaphor. Start with 'Imagine X is like Y...'. Develop the metaphor for 4-5 sentences and wrap it up with a surprising comparison.

formats.name: microdialogue
formats.instruction: Write a fictional conversation between two contrasting characters about a trending topic. Each exchange is 1-2 lines, max. Keep it under 8 lines.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Give deliberately bad advice (for humor). Each step is absurd and over the top. End with a clever disclaimer making it clear it's satirical.

formats.name: visualization
formats.instruction: Describe what a topic or problem would look like as a physical space or landscape. Use descriptive, sensory language. 3-4 vivid sentences, no summary.

formats.name: timeline_twist
formats.instruction: Construct a brief alternate history timeline: what if one thing about your topic had changed? 3-6 bullet points showing events and consequences, then a closing reflection.

formats.name: emoji_essay
formats.instruction: Write a mini-essay where every sentence starts with an emoji that relates to the idea. Make it clever and playful. 4-6 sentences total.

formats.name: deep_dive_dossier
formats.instruction: Build a dossier on an obscure topic: intro, key facts, quick narrative, and at least one curiosity-raising question. Aim for thorough, surprising detail.

formats.name: one_line_flash
formats.instruction: Deliver your post as a single punchy sentence. Make it witty, weird, or thought-provoking. No explanations.

formats.name: ritual_recipe
formats.instruction: Describe a personal or cultural ritual as if it were a recipe. List 'ingredients' and 'steps', then end with one sentence on its meaning.

title_styles: Write a title as a playful question, e.g. 'What if X was actually Y?' or 'Have you ever noticed Z?'
Make the title a mysterious teaser, e.g. 'There’s something hidden inside X you need to see' or 'The secret side of Y nobody told you about'
Use an action-packed title, e.g. 'Unpacking X in five scenes' or 'How I hacked Y with Z'
Formulate the title as a challenge, e.g. 'Can you solve X?', 'I dare you to try Y for a week'
Craft a poetic title, e.g. 'X: a whisper in the chaos', 'Y is the shadow behind Z'
structure_variants: Frame your post as a letter to your future self.
Arrange points as a countdown — start from #5 and end with #1.
Alternate between two voices: agree/disagree, fantasy/reality, past/future.
Begin with a confession or secret, and build your narrative around that revelation.
Start with a surprising statistic, then weave a narrative to contextualize it.
topic_angles: Hidden systems powering everyday life (e.g. logistics, power grids)
Objects we ignore: overlooked details in mundane things
How online trends shape real-world habits
Unusual rituals around the world (with a twist)
The science behind fleeting sensations (taste, sound, forgetfulness)
